text: The people answered, "Far be it from us that we should forsake Yahweh, to serve other gods;

name: Joshua 24:17
text: for it is Yahweh our God who brought us and our fathers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and who did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way in which we went, and among all the peoples through the midst of whom we passed.

name: Joshua 24:18
text: Yahweh drove out from before us all the peoples, even the Amorites who lived in the land. Therefore we also will serve Yahweh; for he is our God."

name: Joshua 24:19
text: Joshua said to the people, "You can"t serve Yahweh; for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your disobedience nor your sins.

name: Joshua 24:20
text: If you forsake Yahweh, and serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you evil, and consume you, after he has done you good."

name: Joshua 24:21
text: The people said to Joshua, "No; but we will serve Yahweh."

name: Joshua 24:22
text: Joshua said to the people, "You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen Yahweh yourselves, to serve him." They said, "We are witnesses."

name: Joshua 24:23
text: "Now therefore put away the foreign gods which are among you, and incline your heart to Yahweh, the God of Israel."

name: Joshua 24:24
text: The people said to Joshua, "We will serve Yahweh our God, and we will listen to his voice."

name: Joshua 24:25
text: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and made for them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.

name: Joshua 24:26
text: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God; and he took a great stone, and set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of Yahweh.

name: Joshua 24:27
text: Joshua said to all the people, "Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us; for it has heard all the words of Yahweh which he spoke to us. It shall be therefore a witness against you, lest you deny your God."

name: Joshua 24:28
text: So Joshua sent the people away, every man to his inheritance.

name: Joshua 24:29
text: It happened after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Yahweh, died, being one hundred and ten years old.

name: Joshua 24:30
text: They buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.

name: Joshua 24:31
text: Israel served Yahweh all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, and had known all the work of Yahweh, that he had worked for Israel.

name: Joshua 24:32
text: They buried the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, in Shechem, in the parcel of ground which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of money. They became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.

name: Joshua 24:33
text: Eleazar the son of Aaron died. They buried him in the hill of Phinehas his son, which was given him in the hill country of Ephraim.

name: Judges 1:1
text: It happened after the death of Joshua, the children of Israel asked of Yahweh, saying, "Who should go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?"

name: Judges 1:2
text: Yahweh said, "Judah shall go up. Behold, I have delivered the land into his hand."

name: Judges 1:3
text: Judah said to Simeon his brother, "Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will go with you into your lot." So Simeon went with him.

name: Judges 1:4
text: Judah went up; and Yahweh delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand: and they struck of them in Bezek ten thousand men.

name: Judges 1:5
text: They found Adoni-Bezek in Bezek; and they fought against him, and they struck the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

name: Judges 1:6
text: But Adoni-Bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

name: Judges 1:7
text: Adoni-Bezek said, "Seventy kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, scavenged under my table: as I have done, so God has requited me." They brought him to Jerusalem, and he died there.

name: Judges 1:8
text: The children of Judah fought against Jerusalem, and took it, and struck it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.

name: Judges 1:9
text: Afterward the children of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites who lived in the hill country, and in the South, and in the lowland.

name: Judges 1:10
text: Judah went against the Canaanites who lived in Hebron (now the name of Hebron before was Kiriath Arba); and they struck Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.

name: Judges 1:11
text: From there he went against the inhabitants of Debir. (Now the name of Debir before was Kiriath Sepher.)

name: Judges 1:12
text: Caleb said, "He who strikes Kiriath Sepher, and takes it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter as wife."

name: Judges 1:13
text: Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb"s younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.

name: Judges 1:14
text: It happened, when she came, that she got him to ask her father for a field: and she alighted from off her donkey; and Caleb said to her, "What would you like?"

name: Judges 1:15
text: She said to him, "Give me a blessing; for that you have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water." Then Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.

name: Judges 1:16
text: The children of the Kenite, Moses" brother-in-law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad; and they went and lived with the people.

name: Judges 1:17
text: Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they struck the Canaanites who inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. The name of the city was called Hormah.

name: Judges 1:18
text: Also Judah took Gaza with its border, and Ashkelon with its border, and Ekron with its border.

name: Judges 1:19
text: Yahweh was with Judah; and drove out the inhabitants of the hill country; for he could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron.

name: Judges 1:20
text: They gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had spoken: and he drove out there the three sons of Anak.

name: Judges 1:21
text: The children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem to this day.

name: Judges 1:22
text: The house of Joseph, they also went up against Bethel; and Yahweh was with them.

name: Judges 1:23
text: The house of Joseph sent to spy out Bethel. (Now the name of the city before was Luz.)

name: Judges 1:24
text: The watchers saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said to him, "Please show us the entrance into the city, and we will deal kindly with you."

name: Judges 1:25
text: He showed them the entrance into the city; and they struck the city with the edge of the sword; but they let the man go and all his family.

name: Judges 1:26
text: The man went into the land of the Hittites, and built a city, and called its name Luz, which is its name to this day.

name: Judges 1:27
text: Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shean and its towns, nor Taanach and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Ibleam and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

name: Judges 1:28
text: It happened, when Israel had grown strong, that they put the Canaanites to forced labor, and did not utterly drive them out.

name: Judges 1:29
text: Ephraim didn"t drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer; but the Canaanites lived in Gezer among them.

name: Judges 1:30
text: Zebulun didn"t drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites lived among them, and became subject to forced labor.

name: Judges 1:31
text: Asher didn"t drive out the inhabitants of Acco, nor the inhabitants of Sidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob;

name: Judges 1:32
text: but the Asherites lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for they did not drive them out.

name: Judges 1:33
text: Naphtali didn"t drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh, nor the inhabitants of Beth Anath; but he lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh and of Beth Anath became subject to forced labor.

name: Judges 1:34
text: The Amorites forced the children of Dan into the hill country; for they would not allow them to come down to the valley;

name: Judges 1:35
text: but the Amorites would dwell in Mount Heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim: yet the hand of the house of Joseph prevailed, so that they became subject to forced labor.

name: Judges 1:36
text: The border of the Amorites was from the ascent of Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.

name: Judges 2:1
text: The angel of Yahweh came up from Gilgal to Bochim. He said, "I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you to the land which I swore to your fathers; and I said, "I will never break my covenant with you:

name: Judges 2:2
text: and you shall make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; you shall break down their altars." But you have not listened to my voice: why have you done this?

name: Judges 2:3
text: Therefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare to you."

name: Judges 2:4
text: It happened, when the angel of Yahweh spoke these words to all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

name: Judges 2:5
text: They called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there to Yahweh.

name: Judges 2:6
text: Now when Joshua had sent the people away, the children of Israel went every man to his inheritance to possess the land.

name: Judges 2:7
text: The people served Yahweh all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great work of Yahweh that he had worked for Israel.

name: Judges 2:8
text: Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Yahweh, died, being one hundred ten years old.

name: Judges 2:9
text: They buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath Heres, in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.

name: Judges 2:10
text: Also all that generation were gathered to their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, who didn"t know Yahweh, nor yet the work which he had worked for Israel.

name: Judges 2:11
text: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and served the Baals;

name: Judges 2:12
text: and they forsook Yahweh, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the peoples who were around them, and bowed themselves down to them: and they provoked Yahweh to anger.

name: Judges 2:13
text: They forsook Yahweh, and served Baal and the Ashtaroth.

name: Judges 2:14
text: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers who despoiled them; and he sold them into the hands of their enemies all around, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

name: Judges 2:15
text: Wherever they went out, the hand of Yahweh was against them for evil, as Yahweh had spoken, and as Yahweh had sworn to them: and they were very distressed.

name: Judges 2:16
text: Yahweh raised up judges, who saved them out of the hand of those who despoiled them.

name: Judges 2:17
text: Yet they didn"t listen to their judges; for they played the prostitute after other gods, and bowed themselves down to them: they turned aside quickly out of the way in which their fathers walked, obeying the commandments of Yahweh. They didn"t do so.

name: Judges 2:18
text: When Yahweh raised them up judges, then Yahweh was with the judge, and saved them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it grieved Yahweh because of their groaning by reason of those who oppressed them and troubled them.

name: Judges 2:19
text: But it happened, when the judge was dead, that they turned back, and dealt more corruptly than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down to them; they didn"t cease from their doings, nor from their stubborn way.

name: Judges 2:20
text: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel; and he said, "Because this nation have transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not listened to my voice;

name: Judges 2:21
text: I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations that Joshua left when he died;

name: Judges 2:22
text: that by them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of Yahweh to walk therein, as their fathers kept it, or not."

name: Judges 2:23
text: So Yahweh left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.

name: Judges 3:1
text: Now these are the nations which Yahweh left, to prove Israel by them, even as many as had not known all the wars of Canaan;

name: Judges 3:2
text: only that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing of it:

name: Judges 3:3
text: the five lords of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites who lived on Mount Lebanon, from Mount Baal Hermon to the entrance of Hamath.

name: Judges 3:4
text: They were left to test Israel by them, to know whether they would listen to the commandments of Yahweh, which he commanded their fathers by Moses.

name: Judges 3:5
text: The children of Israel lived among the Canaanites, the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites:

name: Judges 3:6
text: and they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their own daughters to their sons and served their gods.

name: Judges 3:7
text: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and forgot Yahweh their God, and served the Baals and the Asheroth.

name: Judges 3:8
text: Therefore the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Cushan Rishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Cushan Rishathaim eight years.

name: Judges 3:9
text: When the children of Israel cried to Yahweh, Yahweh raised up a savior to the children of Israel, who saved them, even Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb"s younger brother.

name: Judges 3:10
text: The Spirit of Yahweh came on him, and he judged Israel; and he went out to war, and Yahweh delivered Cushan Rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand: and his hand prevailed against Cushan Rishathaim.

name: Judges 3:11
text: The land had rest forty years. Othniel the son of Kenaz died.

name: Judges 3:12
text: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

name: Judges 3:13
text: He gathered to him the children of Ammon and Amalek; and he went and struck Israel, and they possessed the city of palm trees.

name: Judges 3:14
text: The children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.

name: Judges 3:15
text: But when the children of Israel cried to Yahweh, Yahweh raised them up a savior, Ehud the son of Gera, the Benjamite, a man left-handed. The children of Israel sent tribute by him to Eglon the king of Moab.

name: Judges 3:16
text: Ehud made him a sword which had two edges, a cubit in length; and he wore it under his clothing on his right thigh.

name: Judges 3:17
text: He offered the tribute to Eglon king of Moab: now Eglon was a very fat man.

name: Judges 3:18
text: When he had made an end of offering the tribute, he sent away the people who bore the tribute.

name: Judges 3:19
text: But he himself turned back from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said, "I have a secret errand to you, king." The king said, "Keep silence!" All who stood by him went out from him.

name: Judges 3:20
text: Ehud came to him; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool upper room. Ehud said, "I have a message from God to you." He arose out of his seat.

name: Judges 3:21
text: Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the sword from his right thigh, and thrust it into his body:

name: Judges 3:22
text: and the handle also went in after the blade; and the fat closed on the blade, for he didn"t draw the sword out of his body; and it came out behind.

name: Judges 3:23
text: Then Ehud went forth into the porch, and shut the doors of the upper room on him, and locked them.

name: Judges 3:24
text: Now when he was gone out, his servants came; and they saw, and behold, the doors of the upper room were locked; and they said, "Surely he is covering his feet in the upper room."

name: Judges 3:25
text: They waited until they were ashamed; and behold, he didn"t open the doors of the upper room: therefore they took the key, and opened them, and behold, their lord was fallen down dead on the earth.

name: Judges 3:26
text: Ehud escaped while they waited, and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped to Seirah.

name: Judges 3:27
text: It happened, when he had come, that he blew a trumpet in the hill country of Ephraim; and the children of Israel went down with him from the hill country, and he before them.

name: Judges 3:28
text: He said to them, "Follow me; for Yahweh has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand." They followed him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and didn"t allow any man to pass over.

name: Judges 3:29
text: They struck of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, every lusty man, and every man of valor; and there escaped not a man.

name: Judges 3:30
text: So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. The land had rest eighty years.

name: Judges 3:31
text: After him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who struck of the Philistines six hundred men with an oxgoad: and he also saved Israel.

name: Judges 4:1
text: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, when Ehud was dead.

name: Judges 4:2
text: Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor; the captain of whose army was Sisera, who lived in Harosheth of the Gentiles.

name: Judges 4:3
text: The children of Israel cried to Yahweh: for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel.

name: Judges 4:4
text: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, she judged Israel at that time.

name: Judges 4:5
text: She lived under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.

name: Judges 4:6
text: She sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh Naphtali, and said to him, "Hasn"t Yahweh, the God of Israel, commanded, "Go and draw to Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?

name: Judges 4:7
text: I will draw to you, to the river Kishon, Sisera, the captain of Jabin"s army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into your hand.""

name: Judges 4:8
text: Barak said to her, "If you will go with me, then I will go; but if you will not go with me, I will not go."

name: Judges 4:9
text: She said, "I will surely go with you: nevertheless, the journey that you take shall not be for your honor; for Yahweh will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman." Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.

name: Judges 4:10
text: Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali together to Kedesh; and there went up ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.

name: Judges 4:11
text: Now Heber the Kenite had separated himself from the Kenites, even from the children of Hobab the brother-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent as far as the oak in Zaanannim, which is by Kedesh.

name: Judges 4:12
text: They told Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to Mount Tabor.

name: Judges 4:13
text: Sisera gathered together all his chariots, even nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people who were with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles, to the river Kishon.

name: Judges 4:14
text: Deborah said to Barak, "Go; for this is the day in which Yahweh has delivered Sisera into your hand. Hasn"t Yahweh gone out before you?" So Barak went down from Mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.

name: Judges 4:15
text: Yahweh confused Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his army, with the edge of the sword before Barak; and Sisera alighted from his chariot, and fled away on his feet.

name: Judges 4:16
text: But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the army, to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; there was not a man left.

name: Judges 4:17
text: However Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.

name: Judges 4:18
text: Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said to him, "Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; don"t be afraid." He came in to her into the tent, and she covered him with a rug.

name: Judges 4:19
text: He said to her, "Please give me a little water to drink; for I am thirsty." She opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.

name: Judges 4:20
text: He said to her, "Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man comes and inquires of you, and says, "Is there any man here?" that you shall say, "No.""

name: Judges 4:21
text: Then Jael Heber"s wife took a tent peg, and took a hammer in her hand, and went softly to him, and struck the pin into his temples, and it pierced through into the ground; for he was in a deep sleep; so he swooned and died.

name: Judges 4:22
text: Behold, as Barak pursued Sisera, Jael came out to meet him, and said to him, "Come, and I will show you the man whom you seek." He came to her; and behold, Sisera lay dead, and the tent peg was in his temples.

name: Judges 4:23
text: So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel.

name: Judges 4:24
text: The hand of the children of Israel prevailed more and more against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.

name: Judges 5:1
text: Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying,

name: Judges 5:2
text: "Because the leaders took the lead in Israel, because the people offered themselves willingly, be blessed, Yahweh!

name: Judges 5:3
text: "Hear, you kings! Give ear, you princes! I, even I, will sing to Yahweh. I will sing praise to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

name: Judges 5:4
text: "Yahweh, when you went forth out of Seir, when you marched out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, the sky also dropped. Yes, the clouds dropped water.

name: Judges 5:5
text: The mountains quaked at the presence of Yahweh, even Sinai, at the presence of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

name: Judges 5:6
text: "In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied. The travelers walked through byways.

name: Judges 5:7
text: The rulers ceased in Israel. They ceased until I, Deborah, arose; Until I arose a mother in Israel.

name: Judges 5:8
text: They chose new gods. Then war was in the gates. Was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?

name: Judges 5:9
text: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, who offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless Yahweh!

name: Judges 5:10
text: "Speak, you who ride on white donkeys, you who sit on rich carpets, and you who walk by the way.

name: Judges 5:11
text: Far from the noise of archers, in the places of drawing water, there they will rehearse the righteous acts of Yahweh, the righteous acts of his rule in Israel. "Then the people of Yahweh went down to the gates.

name: Judges 5:12
text: "Awake, awake, Deborah! Awake, awake, utter a song! Arise, Barak, and lead away your captives, you son of Abinoam."

name: Judges 5:13
text: "Then a remnant of the nobles and the people came down. Yahweh came down for me against the mighty.

name: Judges 5:14
text: Those whose root is in Amalek came out of Ephraim, after you, Benjamin, among your peoples. Governors come down out of Machir. Those who handle the marshal"s staff came out of Zebulun.

name: Judges 5:15
text: The princes of Issachar were with Deborah. As was Issachar, so was Barak. They rushed into the valley at his feet. By the watercourses of Reuben, there were great resolves of heart.

name: Judges 5:16
text: Why did you sit among the sheepfolds, To hear the whistling for the flocks? At the watercourses of Reuben There were great searchings of heart.

name: Judges 5:17
text: Gilead lived beyond the Jordan. Why did Dan remain in ships? Asher sat still at the haven of the sea, and lived by his creeks.

name: Judges 5:18
text: Zebulun was a people that jeopardized their lives to the deaths; Naphtali also, on the high places of the field.

name: Judges 5:19
text: "The kings came and fought, then the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach by the waters of Megiddo. They took no plunder of silver.

name: Judges 5:20
text: From the sky the stars fought. From their courses, they fought against Sisera.

name: Judges 5:21
text: The river Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. My soul, march on with strength.

name: Judges 5:22
text: Then the horse hoofs stamped because of the prancings, the prancings of their strong ones.

name: Judges 5:23
text: "Curse Meroz," said the angel of Yahweh. "Curse bitterly its inhabitants, because they didn"t come to help Yahweh, to help Yahweh against the mighty."

name: Judges 5:24
text: "Jael shall be blessed above women, the wife of Heber the Kenite; blessed shall she be above women in the tent.

name: Judges 5:25
text: He asked for water. She gave him milk. She brought him butter in a lordly dish.

name: Judges 5:26
text: She put her hand to the tent peg, and her right hand to the workmen"s hammer. With the hammer she struck Sisera. She struck through his head. Yes, she pierced and struck through his temples.

name: Judges 5:27
text: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay. At her feet he bowed, he fell. Where he bowed, there he fell down dead.

name: Judges 5:28
text: "Through the window she looked out, and cried: Sisera"s mother looked through the lattice. "Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why do the wheels of his chariots wait?"

name: Judges 5:29
text: Her wise ladies answered her, Yes, she returned answer to herself,

name: Judges 5:30
text: "Have they not found, have they not divided the spoil? A lady, two ladies to every man; to Sisera a spoil of dyed garments, a spoil of dyed garments embroidered, of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the spoil?"

name: Judges 5:31
text: "So let all your enemies perish, Yahweh, but let those who love him be as the sun when it rises forth in its strength." Then the land had rest forty years.

name: Judges 6:1
text: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

name: Judges 6:2
text: The hand of Midian prevailed against Israel; and because of Midian the children of Israel made them the dens which are in the mountains, and the caves, and the strongholds.

name: Judges 6:3
text: So it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites came up, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east; they came up against them;

name: Judges 6:4
text: and they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth, until you come to Gaza, and left no sustenance in Israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor donkey.

name: Judges 6:5
text: For they came up with their livestock and their tents; they came in as locusts for multitude; both they and their camels were without number: and they came into the land to destroy it.

name: Judges 6:6
text: Israel was brought very low because of Midian; and the children of Israel cried to Yahweh.

name: Judges 6:7
text: It happened, when the children of Israel cried to Yahweh because of Midian,

name: Judges 6:8
text: that Yahweh sent a prophet to the children of Israel: and he said to them, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "I brought you up from Egypt, and brought you forth out of the house of bondage;

name: Judges 6:9
text: and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all who oppressed you, and drove them out from before you, and gave you their land;

name: Judges 6:10
text: and I said to you, "I am Yahweh your God; you shall not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell." But you have not listened to my voice.""

name: Judges 6:11
text: The angel of Yahweh came, and sat under the oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained to Joash the Abiezrite: and his son Gideon was beating out wheat in the winepress, to hide it from the Midianites.

name: Judges 6:12
text: The angel of Yahweh appeared to him, and said to him, "Yahweh is with you, you mighty man of valor!"

name: Judges 6:13
text: Gideon said to him, "Oh, my lord, if Yahweh is with us, why then has all this happened to us? Where are all his wondrous works which our fathers told us of, saying, "Didn"t Yahweh bring us up from Egypt?" But now Yahweh has cast us off, and delivered us into the hand of Midian."

name: Judges 6:14
text: Yahweh looked at him, and said, "Go in this your might, and save Israel from the hand of Midian. Haven"t I sent you?"

name: Judges 6:15
text: He said to him, "O Lord, how shall I save Israel? Behold, my family is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father"s house."

name: Judges 6:16
text: Yahweh said to him, "Surely I will be with you, and you shall strike the Midianites as one man."

name: Judges 6:17
text: He said to him, "If now I have found favor in your sight, then show me a sign that it is you who talk with me.

name: Judges 6:18
text: Please don"t go away, until I come to you, and bring out my present, and lay it before you." He said, "I will wait until you come back."

name: Judges 6:19
text: Gideon went in, and prepared a young goat, and unleavened cakes of an ephah of meal. He put the meat in a basket and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out to him under the oak, and presented it.

name: Judges 6:20
text: The angel of God said to him, "Take the meat and the unleavened cakes, and lay them on this rock, and pour out the broth." He did so.

name: Judges 6:21
text: Then the angel of Yahweh stretched out the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the meat and the unleavened cakes; and fire went up out of the rock, and consumed the meat and the unleavened cakes; and the angel of Yahweh departed out of his sight.

name: Judges 6:22
text: Gideon saw that he was the angel of Yahweh; and Gideon said, "Alas, Lord Yahweh! Because I have seen the angel of Yahweh face to face!"

name: Judges 6:23
text: Yahweh said to him, "Peace be to you! Don"t be afraid. You shall not die."

name: Judges 6:24
text: Then Gideon built an altar there to Yahweh, and called it "Yahweh is Peace." To this day it is still in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

name: Judges 6:25
text: It happened the same night, that Yahweh said to him, "Take your father"s bull, even the second bull seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the Asherah that is by it;

name: Judges 6:26
text: and build an altar to Yahweh your God on the top of this stronghold, in an orderly way, and take the second bull, and offer a burnt offering with the wood of the Asherah which you shall cut down."

name: Judges 6:27
text: Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as Yahweh had spoken to him: and it happened, because he feared his father"s household and the men of the city, so that he could not do it by day, that he did it by night.

name: Judges 6:28
text: When the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah was cut down that was by it, and the second bull was offered on the altar that was built.

name: Judges 6:29
text: They said one to another, "Who has done this thing?" When they inquired and asked, they said, "Gideon the son of Joash has done this thing."

name: Judges 6:30
text: Then the men of the city said to Joash, "Bring out your son, that he may die, because he has broken down the altar of Baal, and because he has cut down the Asherah that was by it."

name: Judges 6:31
text: Joash said to all who stood against him, "Will you contend for Baal? Or will you save him? He who will contend for him, let him be put to death by morning. If he is a god, let him contend for himself, because someone has broken down his altar."

name: Judges 6:32
text: Therefore on that day he named him Jerub-Baal, saying, "Let Baal contend against him, because he has broken down his altar."

name: Judges 6:33
text: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east assembled themselves together; and they passed over, and encamped in the valley of Jezreel.

name: Judges 6:34
text: But the Spirit of Yahweh came on Gideon; and he blew a trumpet; and Abiezer was gathered together after him.

name: Judges 6:35
text: He sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; and they also were gathered together after him: and he sent messengers to Asher, and to Zebulun, and to Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.

name: Judges 6:36
text: Gideon said to God, "If you will save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken,

name: Judges 6:37
text: behold, I will put a fleece of wool on the threshing floor; if there is dew on the fleece only, and it is dry on all the ground, then shall I know that you will save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken."

name: Judges 6:38
text: It was so; for he rose up early on the next day, and pressed the fleece together, and wrung the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of water.

name: Judges 6:39
text: Gideon said to God, "Don"t let your anger be kindled against me, and I will speak but this once. Please let me make a trial just this once with the fleece. Let it now be dry only on the fleece, and on all the ground let there be dew."

name: Judges 6:40
text: God did so that night: for it was dry on the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.

name: Judges 7:1
text: Then Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, and all the people who were with him, rose up early, and encamped beside the spring of Harod: and the camp of Midian was on the north side of them, by the hill of Moreh, in the valley.

name: Judges 7:2
text: Yahweh said to Gideon, "The people who are with you are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hand, lest Israel vaunt themselves against me, saying, "My own hand has saved me."

name: Judges 7:3
text: Now therefore proclaim in the ears of the people, saying, "Whoever is fearful and trembling, let him return and depart from Mount Gilead."" Twenty-two thousand of the people returned, and ten thousand remained.

name: Judges 7:4
text: Yahweh said to Gideon, "The people are still too many. Bring them down to the water, and I will test them for you there. It shall be, that of whom I tell you, "This shall go with you," the same shall go with you; and of whoever I tell you, "This shall not go with you," the same shall not go."

name: Judges 7:5
text: So he brought down the people to the water; and Yahweh said to Gideon, "Everyone who laps of the water with his tongue, like a dog laps, you shall set him by himself; likewise everyone who bows down on his knees to drink."

name: Judges 7:6
text: The number of those who lapped, putting their hand to their mouth, was three hundred men; but all the rest of the people bowed down on their knees to drink water.

name: Judges 7:7
text: Yahweh said to Gideon, "By the three hundred men who lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into your hand. Let all the other people go, each to his own place."

name: Judges 7:8
text: So the people took food in their hand, and their trumpets; and he sent all the men of Israel every man to his tent, but retained the three hundred men: and the camp of Midian was beneath him in the valley.

name: Judges 7:9
text: It happened the same night, that Yahweh said to him, "Arise, go down into the camp; for I have delivered it into your hand.

name: Judges 7:10
text: But if you are afraid to go down, go with Purah your servant down to the camp:

name: Judges 7:11
text: and you shall hear what they say; and afterward your hands will be strengthened to go down into the camp." Then went he down with Purah his servant to the outermost part of the armed men who were in the camp.

name: Judges 7:12
text: The Midianites and the Amalekites and all the children of the east lay along in the valley like locusts for multitude; and their camels were without number, as the sand which is on the seashore for multitude.

name: Judges 7:13
text: When Gideon had come, behold, there was a man telling a dream to his fellow; and he said, "Behold, I dreamed a dream; and behold, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the camp of Midian, and came to the tent, and struck it so that it fell, and turned it upside down, so that the tent lay flat."

name: Judges 7:14
text: His fellow answered, "This is nothing other than the sword of Gideon the son of Joash, a man of Israel. God has delivered Midian into his hand, with all the army."

name: Judges 7:15
text: It was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and its interpretation, that he worshiped; and he returned into the camp of Israel, and said, "Arise; for Yahweh has delivered the army of Midian into your hand!"

name: Judges 7:16
text: He divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put into the hands of all of them trumpets, and empty pitchers, with torches within the pitchers.

name: Judges 7:17
text: He said to them, "Watch me, and do likewise. Behold, when I come to the outermost part of the camp, it shall be that, as I do, so you shall do.

name: Judges 7:18
text: When I blow the trumpet, I and all who are with me, then blow the trumpets also on every side of all the camp, and shout, "For Yahweh and for Gideon!""

name: Judges 7:19
text: So Gideon, and the hundred men who were with him, came to the outermost part of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch, when they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and broke in pieces the pitchers that were in their hands.

name: Judges 7:20
text: The three companies blew the trumpets, and broke the pitchers, and held the torches in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands with which to blow; and they shouted, "The sword of Yahweh and of Gideon!"

name: Judges 7:21
text: They each stood in his place around the camp; and all the army ran; and they shouted, and put them to flight.

name: Judges 7:22
text: They blew the three hundred trumpets, and Yahweh set every man"s sword against his fellow, and against all the army; and the army fled as far as Beth Shittah toward Zererah, as far as the border of Abel Meholah, by Tabbath.

name: Judges 7:23
text: The men of Israel were gathered together out of Naphtali, and out of Asher, and out of all Manasseh, and pursued after Midian.

name: Judges 7:24
text: Gideon sent messengers throughout all the hill country of Ephraim, saying, "Come down against Midian, and take before them the waters, as far as Beth Barah, even the Jordan!" So all the men of Ephraim were gathered together, and took the waters as far as Beth Barah, even the Jordan.

name: Judges 7:25
text: They took the two princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and they killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they killed at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian: and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon beyond the Jordan.

name: Judges 8:1
text: The men of Ephraim said to him, "Why have you treated us this way, that you didn"t call us, when you went to fight with Midian?" They rebuked him sharply.

name: Judges 8:2
text: He said to them, "What have I now done in comparison with you? Isn"t the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?

name: Judges 8:3
text: God has delivered into your hand the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb! What was I able to do in comparison with you?" Then their anger was abated toward him, when he had said that.

name: Judges 8:4
text: Gideon came to the Jordan, and passed over, he, and the three hundred men who were with him, faint, yet pursuing.

name: Judges 8:5
text: He said to the men of Succoth, "Please give loaves of bread to the people who follow me; for they are faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian."

name: Judges 8:6
text: The princes of Succoth said, "Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in your hand, that we should give bread to your army?"

name: Judges 8:7
text: Gideon said, "Therefore when Yahweh has delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers."

name: Judges 8:8
text: He went up there to Penuel, and spoke to them in the same way; and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered.

name: Judges 8:9
text: He spoke also to the men of Penuel, saying, "When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower."

name: Judges 8:10
text: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their armies with them, about fifteen thousand men, all who were left of all the army of the children of the east; for there fell one hundred twenty thousand men who drew sword.

name: Judges 8:11
text: Gideon went up by the way of those who lived in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and struck the army; for the army was secure.

name: Judges 8:12
text: Zebah and Zalmunna fled; and he pursued after them; and he took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and confused all the army.

name: Judges 8:13
text: Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle from the ascent of Heres.

name: Judges 8:14
text: He caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and inquired of him: and he described for him the princes of Succoth, and its elders, seventy-seven men.

name: Judges 8:15
text: He came to the men of Succoth, and said, "See Zebah and Zalmunna, concerning whom you taunted me, saying, "Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in your hand, that we should give bread to your men who are weary?""

name: Judges 8:16
text: He took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.

name: Judges 8:17
text: He broke down the tower of Penuel, and killed the men of the city.

name: Judges 8:18
text: Then he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, "What kind of men were they whom you killed at Tabor?" They answered, "They were like you. Each one resembled the children of a king."

name: Judges 8:19
text: He said, "They were my brothers, the sons of my mother. As Yahweh lives, if you had saved them alive, I would not kill you."

name: Judges 8:20
text: He said to Jether his firstborn, "Get up, and kill them!" But the youth didn"t draw his sword; for he was afraid, because he was yet a youth.

name: Judges 8:21
text: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, "Rise and fall on us; for as the man is, so is his strength." Gideon arose, and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels" necks.

name: Judges 8:22
text: Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, "Rule over us, both you, and your son, and your son"s son also; for you have saved us out of the hand of Midian."

name: Judges 8:23
text: Gideon said to them, "I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you. Yahweh shall rule over you."

name: Judges 8:24
text: Gideon said to them, "I would make a request of you, that you would give me every man the earrings of his spoil." (For they had golden earrings, because they were Ishmaelites.)

name: Judges 8:25
text: They answered, "We will willingly give them." They spread a garment, and every man threw the earrings of his spoil into it.

name: Judges 8:26
text: The weight of the golden earrings that he requested was one thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold, besides the crescents, and the pendants, and the purple clothing that was on the kings of Midian, and besides the chains that were about their camels" necks.

name: Judges 8:27
text: Gideon made an ephod of it, and put it in his city, even in Ophrah: and all Israel played the prostitute after it there; and it became a snare to Gideon, and to his house.

name: Judges 8:28
text: So Midian was subdued before the children of Israel, and they lifted up their heads no more. The land had rest forty years in the days of Gideon.

name: Judges 8:29
text: Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and lived in his own house.

name: Judges 8:30
text: Gideon had seventy sons conceived from his body; for he had many wives.

name: Judges 8:31
text: His concubine who was in Shechem, she also bore him a son, and he named him Abimelech.

name: Judges 8:32
text: Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

name: Judges 8:33
text: It happened, as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel turned again, and played the prostitute after the Baals, and made Baal Berith their god.

name: Judges 8:34
text: The children of Israel didn"t remember Yahweh their God, who had delivered them out of the hand of all their enemies on every side;

name: Judges 8:35
text: neither did they show kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shown to Israel.

name: Judges 9:1
text: Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother"s brothers, and spoke with them, and with all the family of the house of his mother"s father, saying,

name: Judges 9:2
text: "Please speak in the ears of all the men of Shechem, "Is it better for you that all the sons of Jerubbaal, who are seventy persons, rule over you, or that one rule over you?" Remember also that I am your bone and your flesh."

name: Judges 9:3
text: His mother"s brothers spoke of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, "He is our brother."

name: Judges 9:4
text: They gave him seventy pieces of silver out of the house of Baal Berith, with which Abimelech hired vain and light fellows, who followed him.

name: Judges 9:5
text: He went to his father"s house at Ophrah, and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal, being seventy persons, on one stone: but Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.

name: Judges 9:6
text: All the men of Shechem assembled themselves together, and all the house of Millo, and went and made Abimelech king, by the oak of the pillar that was in Shechem.

name: Judges 9:7
text: When they told it to Jotham, he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice, and cried, and said to them, "Listen to me, you men of Shechem, that God may listen to you.

name: Judges 9:8
text: The trees went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and they said to the olive tree, "Reign over us."

name: Judges 9:9
text: "But the olive tree said to them, "Should I leave my fatness, with which by me they honor God and man, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?"

name: Judges 9:10
text: "The trees said to the fig tree, "Come and reign over us."

name: Judges 9:11
text: "But the fig tree said to them, "Should I leave my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?"

name: Judges 9:12
text: "The trees said to the vine, "Come and reign over us."

name: Judges 9:13
text: "The vine said to them, "Should I leave my new wine, which cheers God and man, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?"

name: Judges 9:14
text: "Then all the trees said to the bramble, "Come and reign over us."

name: Judges 9:15
text: "The bramble said to the trees, "If in truth you anoint me king over you, then come and take refuge in my shade; and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon."

name: Judges 9:16
text: "Now therefore, if you have dealt truly and righteously, in that you have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands

name: Judges 9:17
text: (for my father fought for you, and risked his life, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian:

name: Judges 9:18
text: and you have risen up against my father"s house this day, and have slain his sons, seventy persons, on one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his female servant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother);

name: Judges 9:19
text: if you then have dealt truly and righteously with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:

name: Judges 9:20
text: but if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the men of Shechem, and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem, and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech."

name: Judges 9:21
text: Jotham ran away, and fled, and went to Beer, and lived there, for fear of Abimelech his brother.

name: Judges 9:22
text: Abimelech was prince over Israel three years.

name: Judges 9:23
text: God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:

name: Judges 9:24
text: that the violence done to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come, and that their blood might be laid on Abimelech their brother, who killed them, and on the men of Shechem, who strengthened his hands to kill his brothers.

name: Judges 9:25
text: The men of Shechem set an ambush for him on the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all who came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.

name: Judges 9:26
text: Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brothers, and went over to Shechem; and the men of Shechem put their trust in him.

name: Judges 9:27
text: They went out into the field, and harvested their vineyards, and trod the grapes, and held festival, and went into the house of their god, and ate and drank, and cursed Abimelech.

name: Judges 9:28
text: Gaal the son of Ebed said, "Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? Isn"t he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? Serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: but why should we serve him?

name: Judges 9:29
text: Would that this people were under my hand! Then I would remove Abimelech." He said to Abimelech, "Increase your army, and come out!"

name: Judges 9:30
text: When Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.

name: Judges 9:31
text: He sent messengers to Abimelech craftily, saying, "Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his brothers have come to Shechem; and behold, they incite the city against you.

name: Judges 9:32
text: Now therefore, go up by night, you and the people who are with you, and lie in wait in the field:

name: Judges 9:33
text: and it shall be, that in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, you shall rise early, and rush on the city; and behold, when he and the people who are with him come out against you, then may you do to them as you shall find occasion."

name: Judges 9:34
text: Abimelech rose up, and all the people who were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.

name: Judges 9:35
text: Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and Abimelech rose up, and the people who were with him, from the ambush.

name: Judges 9:36
text: When Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, "Behold, people are coming down from the tops of the mountains." Zebul said to him, "You see the shadow of the mountains as if they were men."

name: Judges 9:37
text: Gaal spoke again and said, "Behold, people are coming down by the middle of the land, and one company comes by the way of the oak of Meonenim."

name: Judges 9:38
text: Then Zebul said to him, "Now where is your mouth, that you said, "Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him?" Isn"t this the people that you have despised? Please go out now and fight with them."

name: Judges 9:39
text: Gaal went out before the men of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech.

name: Judges 9:40
text: Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and many fell wounded, even to the entrance of the gate.

name: Judges 9:41
text: Abimelech lived at Arumah: and Zebul drove out Gaal and his brothers, that they should not dwell in Shechem.

name: Judges 9:42
text: It happened on the next day, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.

name: Judges 9:43
text: He took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field; and he looked, and behold, the people came forth out of the city; He rose up against them, and struck them.

name: Judges 9:44
text: Abimelech, and the companies that were with him, rushed forward, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and the two companies rushed on all who were in the field, and struck them.

name: Judges 9:45
text: Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city, and killed the people who were therein: and he beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.

name: Judges 9:46
text: When all the men of the tower of Shechem heard of it, they entered into the stronghold of the house of Elberith.

name: Judges 9:47
text: It was told Abimelech that all the men of the tower of Shechem were gathered together.

name: Judges 9:48
text: Abimelech went up to Mount Zalmon, he and all the people who were with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it up, and laid it on his shoulder: and he said to the people who were with him, "What you have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done!"

name: Judges 9:49
text: All the people likewise each cut down his bough, and followed Abimelech, and put them at the base of the stronghold, and set the stronghold on fire on them; so that all the people of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women.

name: Judges 9:50
text: Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.

name: Judges 9:51
text: But there was a strong tower within the city, and there fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and went up to the roof of the tower.

name: Judges 9:52
text: Abimelech came to the tower, and fought against it, and drew near to the door of the tower to burn it with fire.

name: Judges 9:53
text: A certain woman cast an upper millstone on Abimelech"s head, and broke his skull.

name: Judges 9:54
text: Then he called hastily to the young man his armor bearer, and said to him, "Draw your sword, and kill me, that men not say of me, "A woman killed him." His young man thrust him through, and he died."

name: Judges 9:55
text: When the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every man to his place.

name: Judges 9:56
text: Thus God requited the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did to his father, in killing his seventy brothers;

name: Judges 9:57
text: and all the wickedness of the men of Shechem did God requite on their heads: and on them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.

name: Judges 10:1
text: After Abimelech there arose to save Israel Tola the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar; and he lived in Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.

name: Judges 10:2
text: He judged Israel twenty-three years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.

name: Judges 10:3
text: After him arose Jair, the Gileadite; and he judged Israel twenty-two years.

name: Judges 10:4
text: He had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkey colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havvoth Jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.

name: Judges 10:5
text: Jair died, and was buried in Kamon.

name: Judges 10:6
text: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and served the Baals, and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Syria, and the gods of Sidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines; and they forsook Yahweh, and didn"t serve him.

name: Judges 10:7
text: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the children of Ammon.

name: Judges 10:8
text: They troubled and oppressed the children of Israel that year. For eighteen years, they oppressed all the children of Israel that were beyond the Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.

name: Judges 10:9
text: The children of Ammon passed over the Jordan to fight also against Judah, and against Benjamin, and against the house of Ephraim; so that Israel was very distressed.

name: Judges 10:10
text: The children of Israel cried to Yahweh, saying, "We have sinned against you, even because we have forsaken our God, and have served the Baals."

name: Judges 10:11
text: Yahweh said to the children of Israel, "Didn"t I save you from the Egyptians, and from the Amorites, from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines?

name: Judges 10:12
text: The Sidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites, oppressed you; and you cried to me, and I saved you out of their hand.

name: Judges 10:13
text: Yet you have forsaken me, and served other gods: therefore I will save you no more.

name: Judges 10:14
text: Go and cry to the gods which you have chosen. Let them save you in the time of your distress!"

name: Judges 10:15
text: The children of Israel said to Yahweh, "We have sinned: do you to us whatever seems good to you; only deliver us, please, this day."

name: Judges 10:16
text: They put away the foreign gods from among them, and served Yahweh; and his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.

name: Judges 10:17
text: Then the children of Ammon were gathered together, and encamped in Gilead. The children of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.

name: Judges 10:18
text: The people, the princes of Gilead, said one to another, "What man is he who will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? He shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead."

name: Judges 11:1
text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor, and he was the son of a prostitute: and Gilead became the father of Jephthah.

name: Judges 11:2
text: Gilead"s wife bore him sons; and when his wife"s sons grew up, they drove out Jephthah, and said to him, "You shall not inherit in our father"s house; for you are the son of another woman."

name: Judges 11:3
text: Then Jephthah fled from his brothers, and lived in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain fellows to Jephthah, and they went out with him.

name: Judges 11:4
text: It happened after a while, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel.

name: Judges 11:5
text: It was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to get Jephthah out of the land of Tob;

name: Judges 11:6
text: and they said to Jephthah, "Come and be our chief, that we may fight with the children of Ammon."

name: Judges 11:7
text: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, "Didn"t you hate me, and drive me out of my father"s house? Why have you come to me now when you are in distress?"

name: Judges 11:8
text: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, "Therefore we have turned again to you now, that you may go with us, and fight with the children of Ammon; and you shall be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead."

name: Judges 11:9
text: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, "If you bring me home again to fight with the children of Ammon, and Yahweh deliver them before me, shall I be your head?"

name: Judges 11:10
text: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, "Yahweh shall be witness between us; surely according to your word so will we do."

name: Judges 11:11
text: Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and chief over them: and Jephthah spoke all his words before Yahweh in Mizpah.

name: Judges 11:12
text: Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, "What have you to do with me, that you have come to me to fight against my land?"

name: Judges 11:13
text: The king of the children of Ammon answered to the messengers of Jephthah, "Because Israel took away my land, when he came up out of Egypt, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and to the Jordan: now therefore restore that territory again peaceably."

name: Judges 11:14
text: Jephthah sent messengers again to the king of the children of Ammon;

name: Judges 11:15
text: and he said to him, "Thus says Jephthah: Israel didn"t take away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon,

name: Judges 11:16
text: but when they came up from Egypt, and Israel went through the wilderness to the Red Sea, and came to Kadesh;

name: Judges 11:17
text: then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, "Please let me pass through your land;" but the king of Edom didn"t listen. In the same way, he sent to the king of Moab; but he would not: and Israel stayed in Kadesh.

name: Judges 11:18
text: Then they went through the wilderness, and went around the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; but they didn"t come within the border of Moab, for the Arnon was the border of Moab.

name: Judges 11:19
text: Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said to him, "Please let us pass through your land to my place."

name: Judges 11:20
text: But Sihon didn"t trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

name: Judges 11:21
text: Yahweh, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they struck them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.

name: Judges 11:22
text: They possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even to the Jordan.

name: Judges 11:23
text: So now Yahweh, the God of Israel, has dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and should you possess them?

name: Judges 11:24
text: Won"t you possess that which Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So whoever Yahweh our God has dispossessed from before us, them will we possess.

name: Judges 11:25
text: Now are you anything better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them?

name: Judges 11:26
text: While Israel lived in Heshbon and its towns, and in Aroer and its towns, and in all the cities that are along by the side of the Arnon, three hundred years; why didn"t you recover them within that time?

name: Judges 11:27
text: I therefore have not sinned against you, but you do me wrong to war against me. Yahweh, the Judge, be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon."

name: Judges 11:28
text: However the king of the children of Ammon didn"t listen to the words of Jephthah which he sent him.

name: Judges 11:29
text: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.

name: Judges 11:30
text: Jephthah vowed a vow to Yahweh, and said, "If you will indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand,

name: Judges 11:31
text: then it shall be, that whatever comes forth from the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, it shall be Yahweh"s, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering."

name: Judges 11:32
text: So Jephthah passed over to the children of Ammon to fight against them; and Yahweh delivered them into his hand.

name: Judges 11:33
text: He struck them from Aroer until you come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and to Abelcheramim, with a very great slaughter. So the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.

name: Judges 11:34
text: Jephthah came to Mizpah to his house; and behold, his daughter came out to meet him with tambourines and with dances: and she was his only child; besides her he had neither son nor daughter.

name: Judges 11:35
text: It happened, when he saw her, that he tore his clothes, and said, "Alas, my daughter! You have brought me very low, and you are one of those who trouble me; for I have opened my mouth to Yahweh, and I can"t go back."

name: Judges 11:36
text: She said to him, "My father, you have opened your mouth to Yahweh; do to me according to that which has proceeded out of your mouth, because Yahweh has taken vengeance for you on your enemies, even on the children of Ammon."

name: Judges 11:37
text: She said to her father, "Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may depart and go down on the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions."

name: Judges 11:38
text: He said, "Go." He sent her away for two months: and she departed, she and her companions, and mourned her virginity on the mountains.

name: Judges 11:39
text: It happened at the end of two months, that she returned to her father, who did with her according to his vow which he had vowed: and she was a virgin. It was a custom in Israel,

name: Judges 11:40
text: that the daughters of Israel went yearly to celebrate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.

name: Judges 12:1
text: The men of Ephraim were gathered together, and passed northward; and they said to Jephthah, "Why did you pass over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didn"t call us to go with you? We will burn your house around you with fire!"

name: Judges 12:2
text: Jephthah said to them, "I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, you didn"t save me out of their hand.

name: Judges 12:3
text: When I saw that you didn"t save me, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand. Why then have you come up to me this day, to fight against me?"

name: Judges 12:4
text: Then Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim; and the men of Gilead struck Ephraim, because they said, "You are fugitives of Ephraim, you Gileadites, in the midst of Ephraim, and in the midst of Manasseh."

name: Judges 12:5
text: The Gileadites took the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. It was so, that when the fugitives of Ephraim said, "Let me go over," the men of Gilead said to him, "Are you an Ephraimite?" If he said, "No;"

name: Judges 12:6
text: then they said to him, "Now say "Shibboleth;"" and he said "Sibboleth;" for he couldn"t manage to pronounce it right: then they siezed him, and killed him at the fords of the Jordan. At that time, forty-two thousand of Ephraim fell.

name: Judges 12:7
text: Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died, and was buried in the cities of Gilead.

name: Judges 12:8
text: After him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.

name: Judges 12:9
text: He had thirty sons; and thirty daughters he sent abroad, and thirty daughters he brought in from abroad for his sons. He judged Israel seven years.

name: Judges 12:10
text: Ibzan died, and was buried at Bethlehem.

name: Judges 12:11
text: After him Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.

name: Judges 12:12
text: Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.

name: Judges 12:13
text: After him Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel.

name: Judges 12:14
text: He had forty sons and thirty sons" sons, who rode on seventy donkey colts: and he judged Israel eight years.

name: Judges 12:15
text: Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.

name: Judges 13:1
text: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh; and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.

name: Judges 13:2
text: There was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and didn"t bear.

name: Judges 13:3
text: The angel of Yahweh appeared to the woman, and said to her, "See now, you are barren, and don"t bear; but you shall conceive, and bear a son.

name: Judges 13:4
text: Now therefore please beware and drink no wine nor strong drink, and don"t eat any unclean thing:

name: Judges 13:5
text: for, behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb: and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines."

name: Judges 13:6
text: Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, "A man of God came to me, and his face was like the face of the angel of God, very awesome; and I didn"t ask him where he was from, neither did he tell me his name:

name: Judges 13:7
text: but he said to me, "Behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.""

name: Judges 13:8
text: Then Manoah entreated Yahweh, and said, "Oh, Lord, please let the man of God whom you did send come again to us, and teach us what we shall do to the child who shall be born."

name: Judges 13:9
text: God listened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again to the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah, her husband, wasn"t with her.

name: Judges 13:10
text: The woman made haste, and ran, and told her husband, and said to him, "Behold, the man has appeared to me, who came to me that day."

name: Judges 13:11
text: Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said to him, "Are you the man who spoke to the woman?" He said, "I am."

name: Judges 13:12
text: Manoah said, "Now let your words happen. What shall the child"s way of life and mission be?"

name: Judges 13:13
text: The angel of Yahweh said to Manoah, "Of all that I said to the woman let her beware.

name: Judges 13:14
text: She may not eat of anything that comes of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing; all that I commanded her let her observe."

name: Judges 13:15
text: Manoah said to the angel of Yahweh, "Please, let us detain you, that we may make a young goat ready for you."

name: Judges 13:16
text: The angel of Yahweh said to Manoah, "Though you detain me, I won"t eat of your bread; and if you will prepare a burnt offering, you must offer it to Yahweh." For Manoah didn"t know that he was the angel of Yahweh.

name: Judges 13:17
text: Manoah said to the angel of Yahweh, "What is your name, that when your words happen, we may honor you?"

name: Judges 13:18
text: The angel of Yahweh said to him, "Why do you ask about my name, since it is wonderful?"

name: Judges 13:19
text: So Manoah took the young goat with the meal offering, and offered it on the rock to Yahweh. Then the angel did a wonderful thing as Manoah and his wife looked on.

name: Judges 13:20
text: For it happened, when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, that the angel of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground.

name: Judges 13:21
text: But the angel of Yahweh didn"t appear to Manoah or to his wife any more. Then Manoah knew that he was the angel of Yahweh.

name: Judges 13:22
text: Manoah said to his wife, "We shall surely die, because we have seen God."

name: Judges 13:23
text: But his wife said to him, "If Yahweh were pleased to kill us, he wouldn"t have received a burnt offering and a meal offering at our hand, neither would he have shown us all these things, nor would at this time have told such things as these."

name: Judges 13:24
text: The woman bore a son, and named him Samson: and the child grew, and Yahweh blessed him.

name: Judges 13:25
text: The Spirit of Yahweh began to move him in Mahaneh Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.

name: Judges 14:1
text: Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines.

name: Judges 14:2
text: He came up, and told his father and his mother, and said, "I have seen a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines: now therefore get her for me as wife."

name: Judges 14:3
text: Then his father and his mother said to him, "Is there never a woman among the daughters of your brothers, or among all my people, that you go to take a wife of the uncircumcised Philistines?" Samson said to his father, "Get her for me; for she pleases me well."

name: Judges 14:4
text: But his father and his mother didn"t know that it was of Yahweh; for he sought an occasion against the Philistines. Now at that time the Philistines had rule over Israel.

name: Judges 14:5
text: Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnah, and came to the vineyards of Timnah: and behold, a young lion roared against him.

name: Judges 14:6
text: The Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on him, and he tore him as he would have torn a young goat; and he had nothing in his hand: but he didn"t tell his father or his mother what he had done.

name: Judges 14:7
text: He went down, and talked with the woman, and she pleased Samson well.

name: Judges 14:8
text: After a while he returned to take her; and he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion: and behold, there was a swarm of bees in the body of the lion, and honey.

name: Judges 14:9
text: He took it into his hands, and went on, eating as he went; and he came to his father and mother, and gave to them, and they ate: but he didn"t tell them that he had taken the honey out of the body of the lion.

name: Judges 14:10
text: His father went down to the woman: and Samson made there a feast; for so used the young men to do.

name: Judges 14:11
text: It happened, when they saw him, that they brought thirty companions to be with him.

name: Judges 14:12
text: Samson said to them, "Let me tell you a riddle now. If you can declare it to me within the seven days of the feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothing;

name: Judges 14:13
text: but if you can"t declare it to me, then you shall give me thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothing." They said to him, "Put forth your riddle, that we may hear it."

name: Judges 14:14
text: He said to them, "Out of the eater came forth food. Out of the strong came forth sweetness." They couldn"t in three days declare the riddle.

name: Judges 14:15
text: It happened on the seventh day, that they said to Samson"s wife, "Entice your husband, that he may declare to us the riddle, lest we burn you and your father"s house with fire. Have you called us to impoverish us? Is it not so?"

name: Judges 14:16
text: Samson"s wife wept before him, and said, "You just hate me, and don"t love me. You have put forth a riddle to the children of my people, and haven"t told it me." He said to her, "Behold, I haven"t told it my father nor my mother, and shall I tell you?"

name: Judges 14:17
text: She wept before him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it happened on the seventh day, that he told her, because she pressed him severely; and she told the riddle to the children of her people.

name: Judges 14:18
text: The men of the city said to him on the seventh day before the sun went down, "What is sweeter than honey? What is stronger than a lion?" He said to them, "If you hadn"t plowed with my heifer, you wouldn"t have found out my riddle."

name: Judges 14:19
text: The Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and struck thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave the changes of clothing to those who declared the riddle. His anger was kindled, and he went up to his father"s house.

name: Judges 14:20
text: But Samson"s wife was given to his companion, whom he had used as his friend.

name: Judges 15:1
text: But it happened after a while, in the time of wheat harvest, that Samson visited his wife with a young goat; and he said, "I will go in to my wife into the room." But her father wouldn"t allow him to go in.

name: Judges 15:2
text: Her father said, "I most certainly thought that you had utterly hated her; therefore I gave her to your companion. Isn"t her younger sister more beautiful than she? Please take her, instead."

name: Judges 15:3
text: Samson said to them, "This time I will be blameless in regard of the Philistines, when I harm them."

name: Judges 15:4
text: Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, and took torches, and turned tail to tail, and put a torch in the midst between every two tails.

name: Judges 15:5
text: When he had set the brands on fire, he let them go into the standing grain of the Philistines, and burnt up both the shocks and the standing grain, and also the olive groves.

name: Judges 15:6
text: Then the Philistines said, "Who has done this?" They said, "Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he has taken his wife, and given her to his companion." The Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.

name: Judges 15:7
text: Samson said to them, "If you behave like this, surely I will be avenged of you, and after that I will cease."

name: Judges 15:8
text: He struck them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he went down and lived in the cleft of the rock of Etam.

name: Judges 15:9
text: Then the Philistines went up, and encamped in Judah, and spread themselves in Lehi.

name: Judges 15:10
text: The men of Judah said, "Why have you come up against us?" They said, "We have come up to bind Samson, to do to him as he has done to us."

name: Judges 15:11
text: Then three thousand men of Judah went down to the cleft of the rock of Etam, and said to Samson, "Don"t you know that the Philistines are rulers over us? What then is this that you have done to us?" He said to them, "As they did to me, so have I done to them."

name: Judges 15:12
text: They said to him, "We have come down to bind you, that we may deliver you into the hand of the Philistines." Samson said to them, "Swear to me that you will not fall on me yourselves."

name: Judges 15:13
text: They spoke to him, saying, "No; but we will bind you fast, and deliver you into their hand; but surely we will not kill you." They bound him with two new ropes, and brought him up from the rock.

name: Judges 15:14
text: When he came to Lehi, the Philistines shouted as they met him: and the Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on him, and the ropes that were on his arms became as flax that was burnt with fire, and his bands dropped from off his hands.

name: Judges 15:15
text: He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, and put forth his hand, and took it, and struck a thousand men therewith.

name: Judges 15:16
text: Samson said, "With the jawbone of a donkey, heaps on heaps; with the jawbone of a donkey I have struck a thousand men."

name: Judges 15:17
text: It happened, when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand; and that place was called Ramath Lehi.

name: Judges 15:18
